question.title: How to save data permanently when sending from one Android activity to another?
question.body:
I am developing an Android app where I send data from one activity (MainActivity) to another (SecondActivity) using Intent extras. The data is displayed correctly when I open the second activity, but it does not save permanently â€” if I close the app and reopen it, the data is lost.

How can I save this data permanently so that it persists even after the app is closed and reopened?

I have heard about SharedPreferences but I am not sure how to implement it properly.

Thank you in advance!

answers.body:
here is the basic saving data to sharedPreferences :

in your main activity write this line :

sharedPreferences = getSharedPreferences("name_of_your_preference", MODE_PRIVATE)
editor = sharedPreferences.edit()

val stringToSave = "Hello world"
editor.putString("your_key_name", stringToSave)
editor.apply() // don't forget to apply it, it will only work if you apply

in your second activity :

val sharedPreferences = getSharedPreferences("name_of_your_preference", MODE_PRIVATE) 
val savedString = sharedPreferences.getString("your_key_name", "") // you can give default value, in case stored string not found 

println(savedString)

and remember to declare those object globally

Easy, shot and simple

if you want to learn more :
https://developer.android.com/training/data-storage/shared-preferences

question_comments.body: Please provide enough code so others can better understand or reproduce the problem.

saving data is something that can vary a lot depending on use cases and data retention. before selecting the appropriate data model you should ask yourself severla questions  Is something I want to save also if I uninstall my app? Is something other apps should be able to read? is something that should be deleted after the app is closed?
